Welcome To David Thompson Community Schools Team!
It's Nice To Meet You
Tell Me More

Services

Who we are

The David Thompson Community School Team (DTCST) of the Vancouver Board of Education (VBE) offers programs and services to support students in four areas: nutrition, academic, social-emotional function, and community connectedness. The Community Schools Teams (CSTs) have been in place in the VBE since 2004.

Who we serve

We serve within the David Thompson Community School team hub which includes Douglas Elementary, Douglas Annex, Sandford Fleming, Oppenheimer, Tecumseh Elementary, Tecumseh Annex, and Kingsford-Smith.

What we offer

We provide various and after School Programs for Vancouver students in Kindergarten to grade 12. Our staff and student leaders are passionate and supportive in the growth and development of students and youth. We also provide leadership training and volunteer opportunities to our DT student leaders and access to community events.

Douglas Annex

About

The CST are funded by an annual CommunityLINK grant from the Ministry of Education. Work of the CST is reported to the VBE Board of Trustees and Ministry of Education officials annually. In addition to the CommunityLINK grant, support for Out of School Time program coordination comes from the United Way of the Lower Mainland, and the district also receives funding from the Ministry of Community, Culture and Sport via the Directorate for School Health (DASH-BC) which support the After School Sports and Arts Initiative (ASSAI). A significant number of funders, partners, and providers of In-kind services support programming at the hub level.

Mission Statement

To offer low-cost and participation-based afterschool programs and services to Vancouver South students and families focusing on four key areas of development for personal and academic achievement: nutrition, academics, social-emotional functioning, and community connectedness.


Vision

To provide evidence-based programming that targets the unique needs of the Vancouver South community, and give children and youth of the David Thompson Family of Schools the support they need to become environmental stewards, global citizens, and community leaders.


Values

Inclusiveness

The CST is committed to sharing values of diversity and inclusion of all individuals. With support and positive engagement, staff, volunteers and students can expect to feel comfortable and welcomed. To ensure a sense of acceptance in all individuals, the CST encourages all members to build and connect with each other to create a constructive environment.

Empowerment

The CST empowers their volunteers to lead creatively, inspire, motivate and foster a positive environment for all students. The volunteers possess knowledge, courage and commitment that are shown in their leadership skills. Professional behaviour by the volunteers is vital in remaining good role models for students.

Altruism

The CST's altruistic outlook contributes to the staff extending their care and kindness to their volunteers and students. The CST shows compassion in creating a positive environment for both volunteers and students to forge better relationships in the community they serve.

Responsibility

The CST staff and volunteers will behave in an honest and ethical manner by conducting themselves professionally. Ethical standards at the CST is important, staff and volunteers are responsible and will be held accountable for their actions and decisions.

Financial Hardship Policy:

The Board of Education Trustees is committed to ensuring that no school-age student will be denied an opportunity to participate in a course, class or program because of an inability to pay fees. parent and guardians unable to pay some or all of a school fee are invited to speak to their child's teacher, school counsellor, vice principal, DTCST staff, and/or the school Principal.
